medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began this morning as epigastric and progressed to encompass the patient's right side of his abdomen and back. He describes the pain as 'a ball of fire inside.' He has had episodes of pain like this several times in the past, thought to be related to GI ulcers. He has had several episodes of non-bloody non-bilious emesis. He is fearful to eat today, with his last meal being last night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: IDDM with retinopathy, neuropathy, foot ulcers; Hypertension; GI ulcers; Cholelithiasis w/ cholecystitis s/p cholecystectomy; alcoholic fatty liver; acute pancreatitis; GERD; hypercholesterolemia; Chronic hepatitis, cirrhosis.
